step_by_step.explanation: Organic chemistry is the study of compounds containing carbon and their reactions.

problems.final_answer: Organic chemistry: study of carbon-containing compounds and reactions.

problems.problem: Explain the difference between alkanes, alkenes, and alkynes.

step_by_step.explanation: Saturated hydrocarbons with single bonds only, general formula CnH2n+2.
Unsaturated hydrocarbons with at least one double bond, general formula CnH2n.
Unsaturated hydrocarbons with at least one triple bond, general formula CnH2n-2.

problems.final_answer: Alkanes: single bonds; Alkenes: double bond; Alkynes: triple bond.

problems.problem: Define functional group and give two examples.

step_by_step.explanation: Functional group is an atom or group of atoms that determines chemical properties of a molecule.

problems.final_answer: Functional group: determines chemical properties; examples: -OH, C=O

problems.problem: Draw the structural formula of ethanol (C2H5OH).

step_by_step.explanation: Isomers are compounds with the same molecular formula but different structures or arrangements of atoms.

problems.problem: Classify CH3-CH2-CH2-OH as alcohol, aldehyde, ketone, or carboxylic acid.
Give the general formula for alcohols and ketones.

step_by_step.explanation: Only single bonds, maximum number of H atoms.
Contains double or triple bonds, fewer H atoms.

problems.final_answer: Saturated: single bonds; Unsaturated: double/triple bonds.

problems.problem: Name the IUPAC name for CH3-CH=CH2.

step_by_step.step: Identify parent chain and double bond
step_by_step.explanation: Three-carbon chain with double bond → propene

problems.problem: Explain why carbon forms four covalent bonds.

step_by_step.explanation: Carbon has 4 valence electrons and needs 4 more to complete octet; forms four covalent bonds.

problems.final_answer: Carbon forms 4 covalent bonds to complete its octet.
